inventory.commentary: 23May07 - changed shish-kabob to 1&2, from 2&3 ahouston, updated to wn 2.1 11Aug08 changed shishkebob 1&2 notation to Sense 10. ahouston

sense.name: a financial institution
sense.examples: The bank holds the mortgage on my house. I took my money out of the bank, and put it into stocks. John switched from Chase Bank to PNC Bank.

sense.name: the bank building
sense.commentary: Refers very narrowly to the building where banking takes place.
sense.examples: The bank is on the corner or Nassau and Witherspoon. It takes me ten minutes to walk to the bank.

sense.name: ambiguous between institution and building
sense.commentary: Use this sense when you can't see a distinction between the first and second sense.
sense.examples: The people working at the bank turned me down for a loan. I cashed my check at the bank.

sense.name: sloping land
sense.commentary: Land that slopes downward, especially near a body of water or on a racetrack.
sense.examples: I sat on the river bank and watched the currents. We pulled the canoe up the bank. There's a bank on this turn to reduce centrifugal force.

sense.name: a supply of something
sense.commentary: A stock or reserve, usually for emergencies.
sense.examples: The Red Cross created a blood bank for disaster relief. They set up a food bank for the flood victims.

sense.name: a container for holding money
sense.commentary: A kind of box, usually with a slot on the top.
sense.examples: John smashed his piggy bank to buy comic books. You have to put a quarter in the coin bank when you swear.

sense.name: a row of objects
sense.commentary: An arrangement of similar things, usually in rows or tiers.
sense.examples: He operated the bank of switches. A bank of telephones is standing by.

sense.name: gambling house funds
sense.commentary: The amount of money owned by a gambling house. Probably only the expression "break the bank" applies.
sense.examples: He's hoping to break the bank at Monte Carlo.

sense.name: a ridge or pile
sense.commentary: A land feature, a large amount of something on the ground.
sense.examples: We climbed the sand bank with some difficulty. A huge bank of earth lay between us.

sense.name: a flight maneuver
sense.commentary: The act of a plane heading downward.
sense.examples: The plane went into a steep bank.
